title: RogueBasin
data:
[![](/images/d/d9/RogueBasin_logo.png)](/wiki/File:RogueBasin_logo.png)

The logo of **RogueBasin**

**RogueBasin** is a [wiki](/wiki/Wiki "Wiki") about [roguelike](/wiki/Roguelike "Roguelike") games in general located at <https://roguebasin.com>. You can now participate by [creating an account](https://www.roguebasin.com/index.php?title=Special:Userlogin "roguebasin:Special:Userlogin").

Some interesting pages:

- [NetHack](https://www.roguebasin.com/index.php?title=NetHack "roguebasin:NetHack")
- [Hacklike](https://www.roguebasin.com/index.php?title=Hacklike "roguebasin:Hacklike") versus [Band](https://www.roguebasin.com/index.php?title=Band "roguebasin:Band")
- [Definition](https://www.roguebasin.com/index.php?title=Definition "roguebasin:Definition") - "What is a roguelike?"

In addition, RogueBasin has many pages about individual roguelike games and some pages about roguelike programming. Some roguelike developers create pages about their own games, while a few players post reviews of the games.

## History

While RogueBasin was at roguebasin.t-o-m-e.net, spam forced it to restrict editing to registered users and to block the creation of new user accounts, except through an alternate process publicised in some [Usenet](/wiki/Usenet "Usenet") groups but not the wiki itself. In practice, this made registering an account and contributing to RogueBasin somewhat worthless, because few others would be able to create an account and edit those contributions.

In July 2006, Slash (the administrator) posted an appeal for a new host on the Usenet group rec.games.roguelike.development[\[1\]](#cite_note-1). The result was a migration from t-o-m-e.net to roguebasin.roguelikedevelopment.org.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2).

In June 2021, RogueBasin moved again, this time to its own domain at roguebasin.com.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3).[\[4\]](#cite_note-4).

## Comparison between RogueBasin and NetHackWiki

|               | RogueBasin                                                                                                                                                                                                | NetHackWiki                                                                                                      |
| ------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Scope         | All roguelike games, including [NetHack](https://www.roguebasin.com/index.php?title=NetHack "roguebasin:NetHack"), and [Angband](https://www.roguebasin.com/index.php?title=Angband "roguebasin:Angband") | [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack"), with coverage of derivatives such as [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") |
| Wiki Engine   | MediaWiki 1.36.0                                                                                                                                                                                          | MediaWiki 1.32.5                                                                                                 |
| Content pages | 2,096                                                                                                                                                                                                     | 4,228                                                                                                            |

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) <https://web.archive.org/web/20160409165900/http://angband.oook.cz/rgrd.php?showpost=75394>
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) <https://web.archive.org/web/20160403115708/http://angband.oook.cz/rgrd.php?showpost=80010>
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) <https://blog.slashie.net/2021/06/17/roguebasin-2021-migration-and-some-history/>
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) <https://roguebasin.com/index.php/RogueBasin:About>

[![This article is unlikely to require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/58/Noversion.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article is unlikely to require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
RogueBasin

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
The logo of RogueBasin

RogueBasin is a wiki about roguelike games in general located at https://roguebasin.com. You can now participate by creating an account.

Some interesting pages:

  • NetHack
  • Hacklike versus Band
  • Definition - "What is a roguelike?"

In addition, RogueBasin has many pages about individual roguelike games and some pages about roguelike programming. Some roguelike developers create pages about their own games, while a few players post reviews of the games.

History

While RogueBasin was at roguebasin.t-o-m-e.net, spam forced it to restrict editing to registered users and to block the creation of new user accounts, except through an alternate process publicised in some Usenet groups but not the wiki itself. In practice, this made registering an account and contributing to RogueBasin somewhat worthless, because few others would be able to create an account and edit those contributions.

In July 2006, Slash (the administrator) posted an appeal for a new host on the Usenet group rec.games.roguelike.development[1]. The result was a migration from t-o-m-e.net to roguebasin.roguelikedevelopment.org.[2].

In June 2021, RogueBasin moved again, this time to its own domain at roguebasin.com.[3].[4].

Comparison between RogueBasin and NetHackWiki

Comparative chart (as of June 2024)
RogueBasin NetHackWiki
Scope All roguelike games, including NetHack, and Angband NetHack, with coverage of derivatives such as SLASH'EM
Wiki Engine MediaWiki 1.36.0 MediaWiki 1.32.5
Content pages 2,096 4,228

References

  1. ↑ https://web.archive.org/web/20160409165900/http://angband.oook.cz/rgrd.php?showpost=75394
  2. ↑ https://web.archive.org/web/20160403115708/http://angband.oook.cz/rgrd.php?showpost=80010
  3. ↑ https://blog.slashie.net/2021/06/17/roguebasin-2021-migration-and-some-history/
  4. ↑ https://roguebasin.com/index.php/RogueBasin:About


Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=RogueBasin&oldid=170062"

[[Image:RogueBasin logo.png|frame|right|The logo of '''RogueBasin''']]
'''RogueBasin''' is a [[wiki]] about [[roguelike]] games in general located at https://roguebasin.com. You can now participate by [[roguebasin:Special:Userlogin|creating an account]].

Some interesting pages:
* [[roguebasin:NetHack|NetHack]]
* [[roguebasin:Hacklike|Hacklike]] versus [[roguebasin:Band|Band]]
* [[roguebasin:Definition|Definition]] - "What is a roguelike?"

In addition, RogueBasin has many pages about individual roguelike games and some pages about roguelike programming. Some roguelike developers create pages about their own games, while a few players post reviews of the games.

== History ==

While RogueBasin was at roguebasin.t-o-m-e.net, spam forced it to restrict editing to registered users and to block the creation of new user accounts, except through an alternate process publicised in some [[Usenet]] groups but not the wiki itself. In practice, this made registering an account and contributing to RogueBasin somewhat worthless, because few others would be able to create an account and edit those contributions.

In July 2006, Slash (the administrator) posted an appeal for a new host on the Usenet group rec.games.roguelike.development<ref>https://web.archive.org/web/20160409165900/http://angband.oook.cz/rgrd.php?showpost=75394</ref>. The result was a migration from t-o-m-e.net to roguebasin.roguelikedevelopment.org.<ref>https://web.archive.org/web/20160403115708/http://angband.oook.cz/rgrd.php?showpost=80010</ref>.

In June 2021, RogueBasin moved again, this time to its own domain at roguebasin.com.<ref>https://blog.slashie.net/2021/06/17/roguebasin-2021-migration-and-some-history/</ref>.<ref>https://roguebasin.com/index.php/RogueBasin:About</ref>.
